places.generalDescription: The EME Temple in Vadodara is a unique blend of modern architecture and ancient sculpture, dedicated to Lord Shiva. Constructed by the Indian Army, this contemporary temple features a geodesic dome covered with aluminum sheets, designed by renowned architect Gerard da Cunha. It has been under construction for over 25 years and incorporates aspects of major Indian religions.

sources.snippet: At a distance of 5 km from Vadodara Railway Station, EME Temple is prominent temple located in Fatehgunj locality of Vadodara, Gujarat. Maintained by the Indian Army, it is one of its kind in India and among the must visit places in Vadodara.Also known as Dakshinamurthy Temple, EME Temple is dedicated to Lord Shiva. It was built by the Electrical and Mechanical Engineering (EME) corps of the Indian Army in 1966.
sources.shortName: 22 Best Places to Visit in Vadodara, Things to Do & Sightseeing (2024)

sources.snippet: 3 km from city center 10 out of 28 Places To Visit in Vadodara. Short for Electrical and Mechanical Corps, in honour of the people who built the temple, the EME Temples is a symbol of the secularity practised in the Indian Army, the EME Temple in Vadodara is an aluminium-clad abode, constructed at the intersection of ancient and modern.
sources.shortName: 28 Places to visit in Vadodara India 2024

sources.snippet: Also known as the Dakshinamurty Temple, the EME Temple is a Shiva shrine managed by the Indian Army. The temple boasts of remarkable contemporary architecture featuring aspects of the major religions of India. Covered with aluminium sheets, the geodesic structure of the temple presents a striking sight.

places.name: EME Temple

reviews.text:
A serene and peaceful haven! EME Temple is a beautiful blend of spirituality and natural beauty. The temple's architecture and surroundings are breathtakingly beautiful.
Note - If you're planning to visit here please carry physical copy of your Aadhar card.

The EME (Electrical and Mechanical Engineering) Temple, also known as the Dakshinamurthy Temple, is one of Vadodara's most unique and lesser-known attractions. Managed by the Indian Army, this temple is a fine blend of modern architecture, spiritual significance, and historical importance. It is dedicated to Lord Shiva, in his Dakshinamurthy form, symbolizing wisdom and enlightenment.

The EME Temple is a must-visit for those who appreciate unique architecture, spirituality, and peaceful surroundings. It's an excellent place for devotees, tourists, and history enthusiasts alike. Whether you are religious or not, the temple's ambience and design make it worth visiting at least once.

Architectural Significance:

The temple stands out with its geodesic dome structure, made of aluminium sheets, which is quite rare for a religious site. Designed with a futuristic approach, it incorporates elements from various religions:

The dome represents Islam

The tower (Shikhara) takes inspiration from Hindu temple architecture

The entrance resembles a Christian church

The golden structure inside symbolizes Buddhism

The grill work is inspired by Jain temples

EME Temple is q quiet nice and peaceful place depicting secularism of India. Each and every religion has its own role in our society which is depicted with five gates and symbols of Hinduism, Jainism, Islam, Christianity etc. very well.
All the idols from ancient times are also very very unique
We enjoyed thoroughly
Nav grah temple is a nearby rare temple.

places.address: 85JR+GPV, nr. EME TEMPLE, Fatehgunj, Vadodara, Gujarat 390002, India

places.generalDescription: Sayaji Baug Zoo is a part of the sprawling Sayaji Baug, a park that offers a variety of attractions including a museum, planetarium, and a small train. The zoo, nestled in this 113-acre park founded in 1879 by Maharaja Sayajirao III, provides an opportunity to connect with nature amidst serene surroundings along the Vishwamitri River. The zoo is home to exotic birds and playful mammals, making it an ideal place for wildlife enthusiasts.

sources.snippet: Special features: Picturesque garden, lush greenery with good flora around. It is also called Kamati Baug. It is known for its museum, planetarium, toy train, flower bed clock, and gallery.Timings: 9:00 AM to 10:00 PMWebsite: https://www.gujarattourism.com/central-zone/vadodara/sayaji-baug.htmlLocation charges: No specific charges for photography.
sources.shortName: 12 Pre-Wedding Locations in Vadodara (October 2024)

places.name: Sayaji Baug Zoo

reviews.text:
Sayaji Baug Zoo is truly a gem in Vadodara! I visited recently and was completely mesmerized by the peaceful atmosphere and stunning natural beauty. The sunset view here is just magical - the sky was painted in soft hues of pink, orange, and blue, creating a perfect blend with the surrounding greenery.

The garden is very well-maintained with clean walkways, blooming plants, and tall, shady trees that make for a relaxing stroll. The statue area and gazebo were beautifully lit, giving the park a warm and welcoming vibe even during the evening. Birds flying above and the gentle breeze added to the charm of the place.

It's not just a zoo, but a space where nature and tranquility meet. A must-visit for anyone coming to Vadodara - perfect for evening walks, photography, or simply unwinding with nature.

Sayaji Baug Zoo in Vadodara is a good place to visit with family. There are many animals like lions, tigers, and deer. It is clean and nice. The canteen is good for snacks. Kids like the toy train ride. The garden outside is also very pretty.

I've visited Sayaji Baug Zoo many times, and it's always a wonderful experience. There's so much to see and do-from watching different kinds of animals to enjoying the beautiful gardens and open green spaces. It's a great place for families, especially kids, with a fun playground area and plenty of spots to relax. The zoo is well-maintained, and the overall environment is peaceful and refreshing.

places.address: Vinoba Bhave Rd, Near Kala Ghoda, Dak Bunglaw, Sayajiganj, Vadodara, Gujarat 390005, India

places.generalDescription: Kirti Stambh, a prominent landmark in Vadodara, is a towering structure made of pink Songadh stone that was constructed in 1935 to honor Maharaja Sayajirao Gaekwad III's 60-year reign. The stambh features a lion statue at its pinnacle and offers panoramic views of the city. It is a popular spot for visitors to enjoy sunset picnics and marvel at the architectural grandeur.

sources.snippet: Built in 1935, Kirti Stambh or the tower of fame was constructed by Maharaja Sayajirao Gaekwad III. The Kirti Stambh is one of the highest towers of the city and stands tall as a sign of victory. The Tower has a lion on the top that is faming eastwards and its back is towards the famous Laxmi Vilas Palace. As per Hindu Mythology it is said that the movement eastwards is for salvation, hence the lion faces east.
sources.shortName: Top 10 Places to Visit in Vadodara (Baroda)

places.name: Kirti Stambh

reviews.text: Kirti Stambh, or the Tower of Fame, stands as a profound symbol of Vadodara's cultural and spiritual heritage. Erected in 1935 to commemorate Maharaja Sayajirao Gaekwad III's 60-year reign, this monument is constructed from pink Songadh stone and is crowned with a lion facing eastward. This orientation signifies the Maharaja's transition from worldly duties to a life of spiritual pursuit, embodying the Hindu concept of ‚ÄòVanaprastha'-the stage of renunciation and advisory role in life. Situated near the Polo Ground, Kirti Stambh not only showcases architectural elegance but also encapsulates the philosophical depth of the Gaekwad dynasty's legacy.

Historic landmark of Vadodara.
Also heritage infrastructure from King Gayakwad time.
Situated near the Kothi Gate, this Victory Tower was built to commemorate the victory of Maharaja Sayajirao Gaekwad III and symbolizes the pride of the Gaekwad dynasty.

The area around Kirti Stambh is serene, making it a great spot for those interested in history and architecture. If you're in Vadodara, this hidden gem is definitely worth a stop for anyone who enjoys exploring off-the-beaten-path historical treasures.

Bus üöå Depot
Get the most bus from here. There are so many bus stands for different locations and also taxi and other private vehicles available.

Vadodara's most famous Mahakali Sev Usad üç≤ is nearby this place.

A hidden architectural gem! üß±‚ú® This 12th-century victory tower whispers history with its intricate carvings & panoramic views. Climb the spiral stairs for a surreal sunset vista üåáüì∏.

üöå GSRTC bus made it a breeze-glad the stop was operational during my visit! Quick access, zero hassle.

places.generalDescription: Sayaji Baug, often referred to as Kamati Baug, is a stunning public garden located in Vadodara and is recognized as one of the largest gardens in India, covering an impressive 100 acres. This lush oasis boasts around 98 species of trees and a rich variety of flora, making it a paradise for nature lovers. Visitors can marvel at the largest floral clock in India while enjoying the serene surroundings.

sources.snippet: Also known as Kamati Baug, Sayaji Baug is the largest garden in Western India, built by Maharaja Sayajirao III in 1879. Spread over 45 hectares of land, the garden houses two museums, a zoo, a planetarium, a flower clock, and an operational toy train, among other attractions. The planetarium is situated near the main gate and has daily public shows as well as offering special shows to educational institutions in Hindi, English and Gujarati.
sources.shortName: The Top Things To See And Do In Vadodara

sources.snippet: At a distance of 2 km from Vadodara Railway Station, Sayaji Baug is a public park located in Vadodara, Gujarat. Also known as Kamati Baug, it is one of the largest public gardens in Western India and among the top places of sightseeing in Vadodara.Situated on the banks of Vishwamitri River, Sayaji Baug was built by Maharaja Sayajirao III in 1879. Sprawling over an area of 113 acres, the garden houses a Zoo, Baroda Museum and Picture Gallery, the Museum of Health and Hygiene, the Sardar Patel Planetarium and an operational toy train.
sources.shortName: 22 Best Places to Visit in Vadodara, Things to Do & Sightseeing (2024)

sources.snippet: Built by Maharaja Sayaji Rao Gaekwad in 1879, Sayaji Garden spans an area of over 100 acres and is regarded as one of the largest public gardens in the western part of the country. The presence of the Sardar Patel Planetarium, the Baroda Museum & Picture Gallery, a toy train, a zoo, an aquarium, and over 98 different species of trees make this garden one of the most enticing tourist places in Vadodara. The garden also has a one-of-its-kind gigantic floral clock with a 20-feet diameter dial.
sources.shortName: 27 Best Places to Visit in Vadodara 2024, ‚úîTourist Places List

sources.snippet: Sayaji Baug, not infrequently also referred to as Sayaji Garden, is one beautiful spot in Vadodara, Gujarat, where pre-watery photo sessions are conventionally conducted. This crescent garden spreads over 113 acres and abounds with various types of lush green vegetation. Also spread around are many attractions within the garden to serve as venues to collect beautiful moments.

It happens to be the largest public garden in the Western region of the country. The garden is so huge that it houses the Sardar Patel Planetarium, Baroda museum and picture gallery, as well as a toy train along with an aquarium.

places.name: Sayaji Baug

reviews.text: Sayaji Baug, also known as Kamati Baug, is Vadodara's largest and most beautiful garden. It offers lush greenery, peaceful walking paths, and a refreshing atmosphere. The park includes a well-maintained zoo, the Baroda Museum, and a toy train, making it a great spot for families and children. The Floral Clock and Bandstand add to its charm. With ample space for relaxation and recreation, it's perfect for morning walks, picnics, and sightseeing. The garden is clean, well-maintained, and rich in natural beauty. Whether you're a local or a tourist, Sayaji Baug is a must-visit for a peaceful and enjoyable experience.

It's is nice place to visit. Their is a zoo, lots of different gardens and meusium. Also you can enjoy joy train which take tour of whole garden. If you are planning to visit the whole garden then you can visit from morning so you can timidly visit each place without rush. Pets are not allow and you can also have photography session by taking permission from the authorities.
It is a good place to visit in vadodara. It has lot of greenery and beautiful flower gardens you will really enjoy it. However zoo requires little maintenance and cleanness.

places.address: 857R+835, Dak Bunglaw, Sayajiganj, Vadodara, Gujarat 390018, India

places.generalDescription: The Nandalay Temple in Vadodara is one of the most popular Hindu temples in the city. The temple is dedicated to Lord Krishna, and it is said that devotees are always blessed by Him. The temple also features a beautiful Rajbhog Prasadi, or offering ceremony, which is a great opportunity to get close to Lord Krishna.

sources.snippet: Also known as Nandalay Haveli, the Nandalay Temple is dedicated to Lord Krishna who is worshipped here as Shrinathji. The temple structure is decorated with ornate balconies and arches. The tastefully decorated interior complements the architectural beauty of the exterior.
sources.shortName: 27 Best Places to Visit in Vadodara 2024, ‚úîTourist Places List

places.name: Nandalay Temple

reviews.text: Must visit to experience the Aarti and related ceremonies. Must try the raj bhog. It's a steal for the quality and quantity if food offered.
Attending the evening Arti and Raas is a spiritual experience every Hindu should take part in once

The Nandalay Temple is known for its stunning architecture and intricate craftsmanship. Its design incorporates elements from traditional Indian temple architecture while also introducing modern elements, making it a visually captivating structure. The temple's blend of traditional and contemporary design elements sets it apart from many other temples.

places.address: 8572+GX5, Rajesh Tower Rd, Divya Darshan Society, Gotri, Vadodara, Gujarat 390021, India

places.generalDescription: Mandvi Gate is a significant historical site in Vadodara, dating back to the 16th century. It is a square-shaped pavilion with three arched openings on each side and was once used as a toll gate for traders and merchants. The city's original walls may have vanished, but Mandvi Gate still stands as one of the four imposing gates, reflecting a blend of Islamic and Maratha architecture.

sources.snippet: The historic Mandvi Gate, which leads to the old city, offers a lovely backdrop for a pre-wedding location in Gujarat. Aged buildings, cobblestone streets, and old-world charm create a unique atmosphere. As they explore the meandering passageways, old buildings, and lively street scenes, couples may shoot candid photos representing a classic love story.
sources.shortName: Top 6 Pre-wedding locations in Vadodara for photoshoot 2025

sources.snippet: A major landmark in Vadodara, the Mandvi Gate remains in the city as a powerful testimony to the celebrated Mughal era. It is a square-shaped pavilion that features three arched openings on every side. In the ancient days, the place was used as a toll gate for traders and merchants.

places.name: Mandvi Gate

reviews.text: Mandvi Gate in Vadodara is a prominent heritage structure reflecting the city's rich Hindu architectural influence. Located in the old city, it stands tall amidst lively markets and traditional shops. This beautifully crafted gate was once a key central point and still holds cultural and historical importance. A must-visit for anyone exploring Vadodara's deep-rooted legacy.

A good architecture, but it is not maintained well . We cant get a proper photo of the gate as there is no photo point and traffic going around the gate. But if u r in baroda for the first time you can visit the place and the market near this place.
Mandvi Gate,Pani Gate and Nyay Mandir are the Gates in vadodara city.it is Main Market of vadodara as well.Thanks

places.generalDescription: Nestled across the Vishwamitra River and just a short stroll from Sayaji Baug, Kirti Mandir stands as an impressive tribute to the Gaekwad dynasty in Vadodara. This magnificent temple, dedicated to Lord Shiva, was constructed in 1936 to honor Maharaja Sayajirao Gaekwad III's Diamond Jubilee.

sources.snippet: The former king commissioned Kirti Mandir in memory of his ancestors. Built in 1936 as part of his diamond jubilee celebrations, the E-shaped building is built in the Indo-Saracenic style and has a 35-metre high central shikara, which is topped by a bronze finial showcasing the sun, the moon, and the earth.The impressive structure holds one of Vadodara‚Äôs best kept secrets: five fading frescoes by painter Nandlal Bose. A pupil of Abanindranath Tagore, Bose was known for his ‚Äú Indian style‚Äù of painting.
sources.shortName: 15 best places to visit in Vadodara that are not tourist traps

sources.snippet: Such is the serenity of Kirti Mandir‚Äôs atmosphere that one would choose it to captivate one‚Äôs love story in a beauteous manner. The mandir itself is not just a historic place but a very picturesquely excellent venue, thus forming an excellent backdrop for pre-wedding photography. The architectural details, the beautiful gardens, and the general serenity would set a quite enchanting atmosphere where any two in love would exude their unique personalities and love stories through a camera‚Äôs lens.
sources.shortName: Top 7 Pre Wedding Shoot Locations In Vadodara

sources.snippet: At a distance of 1.5 km from Vadodara Railway Station, Kirti Mandir is the cenotaph of the Gaekwads situated near Vishwamitri Bridge in Baroda. Also known as the Temple of Fame, it is one of the popular and important places to visit in Vadodara.The Kirti Mandir is actually a cluster of temples dedicated to Lord Shiva. It was built in 1936 by Maharaja Sayajirao Gaekwad III of the Gaekwad dynasty to perpetuate the glorious memory of his beloved ancestors.
sources.shortName: 22 Best Places to Visit in Vadodara, Things to Do & Sightseeing (2024)

sources.snippet: Kirti Mandir (or Temple of Fame) in Baroda is a cenotaph, a magnificent temple erected by Maharaja Sayajirao Gaekwad III in the honour of the Gaekwad dynasty of Marathas and its powerful ancestors. It was built in the year 1936 for the Diamond Jubilee celebrations of the Maharaja and consists of balconies, domes, terraces and a shikhara at the centre, which showcases the sun, moon, earth and the undivided map of India.
sources.shortName: 15 Beautiful Places to Visit in Vadodara

sources.snippet: One of the magnificent monuments in Vadodara, Kirti Mandir, is actually a group of temples dedicated to Lord Shiva. Built in 1936 by Maharaja Sayajirao Gaekwad III, Kirti Mandir features stunning terraces, domes, tombs, balconies, and a magnificently designed 35 meters high central sikhara. The shikhara represents the earth, moon, and sun, along with a map of undivided India.
sources.shortName: Top 10 Tourist Places to Visit in Vadodara

sources.snippet: Kirti Mandir or the Temple of Fame is the cenotaph built for the members of the Baroda royal family. Situated near the Vishwamitri Bridge, it is an impressive structure complete with ornate carvings, balconies, terraces, and domes. You can find various murals adorning the walls of this structure that represent the battle of Mahabharata.
sources.shortName: 27 Best Places to Visit in Vadodara 2024, ‚úîTourist Places List

sources.snippet: Kirti Mandir, dedicated to Mahatma Gandhi and Kasturba, is peaceful. The modest beauty of the white marble edifice allows for tranquil and introspective pre-wedding photos. This simple, modest property is ideal for pre-wedding locations that seek a peaceful, reflective atmosphere.

places.name: Kirti Mandir

reviews.text: Kirti Mandir at night feels like stepping into a different world. The soft lighting gives the temple a glowing presence, and the calmness around makes it perfect for quiet reflection. Even though it's in the heart of the city, the atmosphere here is peaceful and soothing. A must-visit spot if you want to experience history, beauty, and serenity all at once.

Although the building itself still looks beautiful, it seems a little like an old palace. There is a Datta Mandir on one side and another temple in a relatively bad condition on the other side of the main building. Good place to click some pictures. But there wasn't much to see there since it was closed by the time we got there (around after 12 pm).

Kirti Mandir, located in Vadodara, is a stunning and unique temple that beautifully represents the architectural heritage of India. Built by Maharaja Sayajirao Gaekwad III, it symbolizes the glory of the Gaekwad family and is often referred to as the "Temple of Fame."

The temple features intricate marble interiors adorned with beautifully carved sculptures depicting scenes from Indian mythology, including the Gangavataran, the life of Meera, and the battle of Mahabharat. The central hall is particularly impressive, showcasing the artistry that defines this heritage structure.

Visiting Kirti Mandir is a delightful experience, especially at night when the temple is illuminated with captivating lights, enhancing its beauty. The well-maintained gardens and lawns around the temple provide a serene atmosphere, making it an ideal spot for family gatherings or quiet reflection.

Kirti Mandir is not only a place of worship but also a cultural gem that attracts visitors for its historical significance and architectural brilliance. Admission is free, and parking is readily available. Although it may be under renovation at times, its charm remains intact, making it a must-visit destination for history enthusiasts and anyone seeking a peaceful escape from daily life. The temple's proximity to Sayaji Bagh adds to its appeal, providing a lovely area for leisurely walks and exploration.

places.address: Kothi Rd, Dak Bunglaw, Sayajiganj, Vadodara, Gujarat 390001, India

places.generalDescription: KOTNA Beach, located just 17 kilometers from Vadodara in Gujarat, is a popular destination known for its water sports activities such as kayaking and boating. Visitors frequent the beach for photography, birdwatching, and various other leisure activities. The sunrise and sunset views at KOTNA Beach are particularly stunning, offering mesmerizing vistas of the flowing river.

sources.snippet: Kotna Beach is located at just 17KM from Vadodara which is famous for various water sports activities like Kayaking and boating. You will see tourist visiting Kotna Beach for photography, do sightings and many more activities. Sunrise and sunset both look amazing at Kotna and gives you mesmerizing view of river flowing around.
sources.shortName: 32 Best Places to Visit Near Vadodara for One-Two Day Trips

places.name: KOTNA Beach

reviews.text:
Kotna Beach offers a delightful escape for both family and friends. Though it's more of a river location than a traditional beach, it provides a serene setting perfect for a relaxing day out. The highlight is the kayaking experience, which is available at an affordable price and adds a touch of adventure to your visit. The views, especially at sunrise and sunset, are spectacular and offer a stunning backdrop for photos.
Additionally, there are snack options available, making it easy to enjoy a meal or a treat while you take in the surroundings. Overall, Kotna Beach is a great spot for a leisurely outing and is highly recommended for its unique charm and enjoyable activities.

Hi
I went there yesterday(Sunday).

1.Sunday is little bit crowdy compared to other working days.
2.Great place to spend time with family & friend
3. Either visit early morning(6-8) or Evening after(5:30-6).
4. Can enjoty party, games, and boating in river.
5.Boating price is quite high but 100Rs/Person ifs a descent negotiation you can do.
6.Local shops are available where you can get bhajiya, packaged food, water bottles, icecream coldrink etc.
7. Route of reaching this place may be little bit challenging as is pass through inside village.
8.Water is not that much pure, but still you will find so many guys taking bath into this.
9. Beach generally close arround 7:30 in summer after sunset , it will become early during winter and rainy season.
10. Beach is somehow dirty, but it's ok.

Good for a quick weekend getaway from BDQ. It's around 20-25km away from most parts of the city and while the diversion road is horrible, it's still drivable. The ‚Äúbeach‚Äù itself is not so much a beach as much as a land parcel next to what feels like a lake, but it was quite peaceful and worth the short drive.

places.generalDescription: Sindhrot Check Dam, also known as Sindhrot Dam, is a popular spot for young people and locals to hang out near Vadodara. Originally built for water preservation, it has become a go-to place for spending quality time. While there is no entrance fee, visitors need to purchase a parking ticket. The area tends to be quite serene but can get muddy during rainy days.

sources.shortName: 32 Best Places to Visit Near Vadodara for One-Two Day Trips

places.name: Sindhrot Check Dam

reviews.text: Shindrot is a good place to visit in summer, you will also find families enjoying. The place has parking fees that is 10-20 rs, there are many stall that sell food like corn , chips etc. The check dam is a great place to have fun in water and enjoy the sunset, but do bring socks as it is slipper, also available to purchase over there. Do visit specially in summe

Check Dam...Sindhrot Dam.. Its Free
My experience at this place has been quite good, especially for youngsters looking to hang out. There is no ticket system in place, but you do have to purchase a parking ticket, which costs 10rs for 2-wheelers and 20rs for 4-wheelers.

I have visited this place multiple times with my friends and colleagues, and it has become a go-to spot for spending quality time. However, it's important to come prepared as the area tends to be quite sleepy. Additionally, while the water is clear, it's disheartening to see that tourists and other people are spreading garbage in the water, which affects its beauty.

That being said, I highly recommend this place as a must-visit. It serves as a simple check dam where you can hang out with friends. The best time to go is during the evening sunset, which offers a picturesque view. You can also find vendors selling corn and packed snacks for your convenience. The roads leading to the place may not be in the best condition, so having a 2-wheeler is preferable.

Overall, it's a beautiful site to spend time with your family or friends. If you visit early in the morning, you can enjoy the peaceful atmosphere, while the sunset adds an extra touch of magic. Moreover, during the monsoon season, this place offers a unique adventure feel.

It's important to remember to take care of nature and avoid spreading garbage around. Let's all contribute to maintaining the cleanliness and beauty of this place.

Last summer, my friends and I visited the local dam for a day of fun. We splashed around in the cool water, played games, and laughed until sunset. It was a perfect day filled with unforgettable memories and laughter.

places.address: CHECK DAM, Sindhrot, Vadodara, Gujarat 388520, India

places.generalDescription: Khanderao Market Building, a landmark from 1906 in Vadodara city, Gujarat, is a bustling hub with clothing and food stalls set up in its garden. The market is popular for street photography and is one of the iconic landmarks of the city. It's part of a list of tourist attractions that draw visitors from around the world to Vadodara. The building was designed by Chisholm, who also worked on other significant structures in India during his time there.

sources.snippet: It is said that at Khanderao Market you can buy anything and everything that might be useful, from birth to death. The Khanderao Market is one of the most vibrant and architecturally striking places in the city. It comes to life at the crack of the dawn and is occupied by vegetable sellers, vendors and flower and fruit sellers.
sources.shortName: The Top Things To See And Do In Vadodara

sources.snippet: Khanderao Market is one of the busiest and most traditional hubs in the city, right at the heart of Vadodara, where couples come to capture a unique and captivating setting for a pre-wedding photoshoot. The old market is such a beautiful blend of tradition and modernity, with its vibrant stalls, architectural intricacies, and charged atmosphere. This will, therefore, turn out to be a perfect choice for those aiming to have their love story captured in a very memorable way.
sources.shortName: Top 7 Pre Wedding Shoot Locations In Vadodara

sources.snippet: Khanderao Market is a perfect place for shopping in Vadodara. The market resides within an impressive edifice built by the Mahararaja, which also houses numerous office buildings. The Khanderao market has flower and fresh vegetables shops and is a favourite spot among street photographers who love to capture the energy of the live and bustling market in their lenses.
sources.shortName: 15 Beautiful Places to Visit in Vadodara

sources.snippet: Khanderao Market is a grand edifice that adorns the cityscape of Vadodara. Constructed by Maharaja Sayajirao Gaekwad III in 1906, the building boasts of impressive architecture. At present, the building houses several important government administrative offices.
sources.shortName: 27 Best Places to Visit in Vadodara 2024, ‚úîTourist Places List

places.name: Khanderao Market Building

reviews.text: This market has been a part of my life for as long as I can remember! It's now my go-to place-I always find fresh veggies and fruits here at prices that are way more affordable than other markets. Shopping here just makes me happy!

Khanderao market is a palatial commercial building located on Chamaraja Road in Vadodara, Gujarat, in western India. It was erected by Maharaja Sayajirao Gaekwad III in 1906‚Äì07 as a gift to the city municipality to mark the silver jubilee of his administration. The offices of the Vadodara Municipal Corporation are located here.
The market was built by Maharaja Sayajirao Gaekwad III in 1906‚Äì07 and named after his predecessor and adoptive father, Khanderao Gaekwad, Maharaja of Baroda (1856‚Äì1870). This market is a palatial commercial building located on Chamaraja Road in Vadodara, Gujarat, in western India. It was erected by the Maharaja as a gift to the city municipality to mark the silver jubilee of his administration. It was built at the cost of about ‚Çπ3 lakh (equivalent to ‚Çπ10.0 crore or US$1.2 million in 2023).

The market was designed in Indo-Saracenic style by English architect Robert Chisholm before his return to England. The two-storey building has two bays connected by an overhead passage with a large central dome rising to a height of 86 feet. Both bays are 70 feet long and 34 feet wide with a cloister around them. It is constructed from bricks and mortar and clad with Dhangdhra stones. The 16 stalls on the ground floor of the main building are occupied by municipal offices, while other stalls on two sides are used by 192 shops. The open courtyard between these two sides is 181 feet long and 156 feet wide and has a central junction.

The main gate takes inspiration from the gate of Dabhoi Fort, while the domes are inspired by Hindu temples and the arches are influenced by Islamic architecture. The perforated stone screens are similar to those of Agra.

The statue of Maharaja Khanderao placed in the courtyard was sculpted by Vinayak Pandurang Karmarkar and was inaugurated by Sayajirao Gaekwad III on December 23, 1935.

In the present day, the offices of the Vadodara Municipal Corporation are located here. Fresh vegetables, fruits, and flowers are sold within the market premises.

‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê | Khanderao Market Building (Moti Market)

We occasionally visit Khanderao Market Building, and it never disappoints. This market is a treasure trove, offering a wide variety of fresh fruits, vegetables, and flowers, both at wholesale and retail prices. The produce is always fresh, and the atmosphere is lively and vibrant.

One of the best parts about shopping here is interacting with the vendors-they are amazing! Their friendly nature and the bargaining system add to the fun of shopping. Additionally, the market offers everything needed for ritual activities, including Pooja items. Overall, a great place to experience the local culture and pick up high-quality goods. Highly recommended!

places.generalDescription: Sur Sagar Lake, also known as Chand Talao, is a prominent urban lake located in the heart of Vadodara. The largest artificial lake in the city, it was built with water conservation in mind. The 120-ft.-tall Shiva statue at its center makes it a popular gathering spot for couples, families, and visitors. Surrounded by lush greenery, the lake offers boat rides for a relaxing evening experience.

sources.snippet: Situated in the middle of the city of Vadodara, the Sursagar Lake also known as Chandan Talao is a peaceful place to visit. Rebuilt with stone banks and masonry in the 18th century, this lake remains full of water throughout the year. A concrete wall has been constructed around the lake making room for people to sit and relax while gazing at the lake and the 120 ft. tall statue of Lord Shiva in standing posture constructed in the middle by the Vadodara Municipal Corporation.
sources.shortName: The Top Things To See And Do In Vadodara

sources.snippet: At a distance of 3 km from Vadodara Railway Station, Sursagar Lake is a beautiful lake situated in the middle of Vadodara city in Gujarat. It is one of the oldest lakes in Vadodara and among the major tourist places in Vadodara.Formerly known as Chandan Talao, Sursagar Lake got its present name after Sureshwar Desai, who was renovated and built earthen ghats with embankments in the 18th century. Later, Malharrao Gaekwad made 'pucca' embankments.
sources.shortName: 22 Best Places to Visit in Vadodara, Things to Do & Sightseeing (2024)

sources.snippet: Situated in the middle of the city, Sur Sagar Lake was originally a small pond built by Shri Sureshwar Desai, so it was named after him as Sur Sagar. Also called Chandan Talav, this 18th-century lake has many underground gates to manage water in case it overflows. One of the best places to visit in Baroda, Sur Sagar Lake, is noted for the 120-feet tall statue of Lord Shiva positioned in the middle of the lake.
sources.shortName: Top 10 Tourist Places to Visit in Vadodara

sources.snippet: Sursagar Lake lies in the very heart of Vadodara and offers a very enchanting destination for a pre-wedding photo shoot. This beautiful lake is otherwise known as Chandan Talav and is full of rich history; its maintenance over these years has been done quite nice. The main center of attraction in this lake is a gigantic statue of Lord Shiva, adding a spiritual artistic touch to any photoshoot.
sources.shortName: Top 7 Pre Wedding Shoot Locations In Vadodara

sources.snippet: Sursagar or Chand Talao located in the heart of the city is one of the most amazing places to visit in Vadodara for couples, families and tourists. Surrounded by lush greenery, the lake has 120-feet tall Shiva statue, right in the middle of the lake. The captivating beauty of Sursagar can be best enjoyed while boating across the lake and is a perfect place for spending a relaxed evening.
sources.shortName: 15 Beautiful Places to Visit in Vadodara

sources.snippet: Located in the heart of the city, Sur Sagar aka Chand Talao is a mesmerizing lake that remains filled with water all year long. The cool ambiance of the lake provides the perfect excuse to spend some time near this water body. There‚Äôs even a concrete wall that runs along the perimeter of this lake, where you can sit during the evening hours and appreciate its serene beauty.
sources.shortName: 27 Best Places to Visit in Vadodara 2024, ‚úîTourist Places List

sources.snippet: The Sur Sagar Lake is located centrally and it is also known as the Chand Talaav. The beauty of the lake is mesmerizing and some are a perfect time to spend time at this Lake because of the cool breeze that emanates from it. The water in this Lake never dries up and there is a beautiful hundred and twenty feet tall statue of Lord Shiva in the middle of the lake.
sources.shortName: 9 Amazing places to visit in Vadodara! Top Places to Visit in Vadodara, Gujarat

sources.snippet: 2 km from city center 7 out of 28 Places To Visit in Vadodara. Decked with lush greenery on all sides, the Sursagar lake is an example of exemplary architecture and mesmerising beauty. Enjoy paddle-boating in these jade waters and go around the majestic 120-foot statue of Lord Shiva that looks upon the lake.
sources.shortName: 28 Places to visit in Vadodara India 2024

places.name: Sur Sagar Lake

reviews.text:
Sur Sagar Lake, located in the center of Vadodara, is a symbol of peace and spirituality. Its most striking feature is the massive golden statue of Lord Shiva, standing tall and radiant in the middle of the lake. At night, the statue glows brilliantly, its reflection shimmering in the calm waters, creating a breathtaking and almost divine view.

The lake is beautifully maintained, with clean surroundings and a peaceful atmosphere that makes it ideal for an evening stroll or quiet reflection. The walkway around the lake is well-lit and offers a relaxing escape from the city's noise. The sound of water and the gentle breeze make the experience even more calming.

Sur Sagar Lake is not just a landmark-it's a place where tradition, devotion, and natural beauty come together. Whether you're visiting for the first time or have seen it many times before, it never fails to leave a lasting impression.

Sur Sagar Lake is popular for the huge Shiva idol right in the centre of the lake.
The gold plated statue is 34 meters tall and was plated using 17.5 kg of gold.
The lake is popular with tourists especially  during sunset.

Quite nice lake, clean & well maintained. The Sur sagar lake is in the heart of City of Vadodara, Gujarat. The walking strip is really very good & you can take quite a big lap of whole lake. The Seasonal migrated birds are beautiful to watch whioe they play in the lake. Must visit place in Vadodara.

And the money you have filled, you will get back 100 rupees when you close your account. One passport size photograph and one Xerox ID proof is required.

Library staff should learn how to speak with people,who comes there for membership. Library is the place where people come to enhance their knowledge and behaviour , but library staff themselves don't have that both.
